reviews.review:
Half-Life: Source is pretty much the classic Half-Life ported to the Source engine. The graphics are pretty much the same, the main differences being water animations, the introduction of ragdolls, and some other physics stuff. And the skyboxes are more detailed now. The maps remain largely the same, so, if you like Half-Life, you'll like this as well.

Personally, I play both games whenever I feel like replaying the series, but that's just because I'm weird like that, as the story in both games is exactly the same, this being a port and all.

Bem vamos lá, quem jogou na época sabe a revolução que foi Half-Life, depois dele os jogos mudaram para melhor. A história de Gordon Freeman começa aqui. Quem não jogou deve comprar imediatamente e jogar essa obra prima da Valve. Recomendo! 10/10

One of the best classic games out there. Story, vision, in-game rules etc are great, but I don't like gameplay sensitivity. Some controls are super sensitive & some are much less sensitive.

This is remastered edition of original Half-Life which runs on modern Source engine, but still graphics needs serious improvement. I'd suggest Valve to re-develop this great game from scratch with modern graphics & special effects.

By far it's sequel's superior. As soon as I started getting into the action, I realized what all the hype was about all these years. And don't even fuck with Black Mesa until you've played this. Don't wanna spoil, but Black Mesa doesn't have about half the game (from what I've been told. I still haven't finished this one.)
But I played Black Mesa first, and the gameplay in HL:S is so much more balanced and fun. The graphics, obviously, have suffered over the years. But if you like shooters and feeling like you accomplish something when you play games, or even love a fucking weird ass narrative told without the protagonist ever speaking, this game for LITERALLY EVERYONE YOU DON'T EVEN NEED TO FIT THE REQUIREMENTS.
Unless you're a chicken, who's more scared of stuff than me. This game has more than a few horror elements later on. Regardless, great game.

It's a legenday game.
PLAY IT.

Score : 7/10

Good old shooter with nice interiors and suspence. Good guns especially hornet.

= 8/10 =

I remember having played [i]Half-Life[/i] during my [i]Quake[/i] and [i]Duke Nukem 3D[/i] phase. It was a mind-blowing experience at the time. The story was inmersive and the tension it built was palpable. [i]Half-Life 2[/i] is superior (two words: Gravity Gun), but it would've been more improved with the female ninja spies, the alien shark and the weird disintegrator gun from this one.

I'd hoped for better graphics on this version since it was a conversion to the Source engine. Sadly, ugly sprites still inhabit Black Mesa, but at least the gameplay holds up after all these years. Also, you can fix the sprite problem with the Hi-Res Texture Pack.

My only real peeve with the Source version is that it doesn't include the free Steam soundtrack DLC just like the original Steam edition. Still, it's a good version of a must-have classic!

Classic Half-Life. Undoubtfully a Valve masterpiece. It has adventure, good shooting, story, and now eith source graphics. I just did'nt liked the speed, that is too great, and there is no toggle walk. But it is really a excelent game.

Waste of money if you have Half-Life already. Nothing is really changed. The water is upscaled and pretty good looking, and theres ambient lighting effects par Half-Life 2 as well as ragdoll effects, but everything else remains unchanged from the Original Half-Life.
Best game EVER.
эту игру должен пройти каждый геймер.
Игра все та же. Если вы еще не прошли первую часть, то это хороший повод пройти ее. Графика немного лучше, взрывы сочнее.

This version of the game was broken in steampipe in 2013, only proper way to play HL: Source is through a physical copy now.  Get this game for GMOD and nothing else, this game is still playable but valve letting it die is rather irresponsible.  You could also just play original goldsource Half Life on steam since that still works and has mods too.
Half Life é Half life, só digo isso. Jogo marcante
A brilliant work that is a landmark in video gaming history. 10/10
长跳是：前进——蹲——前跳，按下蹲键，立刻按跳键，多试几次就知道了~

The original Half Life brought a bit further along by the updated graphics. A great start to the Half Life series, with a strong story and signs of the cinematic cut scenes that later play such a large role in the series.
The classic game with improved lighting, water and other effects. The definitive version.
Хороший ремейк лучший игры в мире на новом движке!

This review was originally a recommendation, but after my latest play through, i have to not recommend it. I'm just gonna make a simple pros and cons list.
PROS:
1. its Half-Life
2. runs on Source engine

CONS:
1. REALLY buggy, even 10 years after release
2. Scripted things don't always work
3. Hitboxes are sometimes only hit by certain weapons (Gonarch boss)

All in all, just get the original. You can get it for the same price and its much better quality. If, for some odd reason, Valve comes back and fixes it, then maybe I'll change my opinion, but don't get it unless you want a few things in Garry's Mod.

Gotta love that update. 

-Just to clarify, this update in particular deleted all of my saves when I was on one of the last chapters. But It was honestly one of the best games I've ever played, all jokes aside. The extra time I spent on it wasn't as horrible as I initially thought it would be. Would recommend.
Get it only if you need the files for Garry's Mod or some mod pack.  This one does not have the other two expansion packs like the original does.
Es el Half-Life clásico en el motor Source. La iluminación, el agua y la IA están mucho mejor que en original, aunque destacan mucho sobre los modelos poligonales y texturas pixeladas del clásico.

Знаменитая игра, наделавшая не мало шуму. Я сам не так давно прошёл её, и я бы сказал: для тех, кто умеет играть). Графика для тех времён отличная, большой арсенал оружия. Вообще эта игра года, поэтому сразу уж поставлю ей 9.5/10 (именно это бы я ей поставил, если бы жил в то время).
The original leviathan of a game which gave birth to a cult following of Gordon Freeman. Now optimised in a beautiful Source engine

played 1000000 hours before the advent of steam)
BEST.

Perfektní hra!
I don't think there would be Steam without this. You have to beat it!
Great storyline. Graphics may look terrible, but I don't judge since this is when gaming was being evolved. (Try Black Mesa: Source if you want better graphics.)
Nearly fifteen years old, and still one of the best games I have ever played!

I know this almost goes without saying, but any gamer alive should play the Half-Life games. Even compared with the modern flashy big-budget single-player shooter extravaganzas of today (I'm looking at you, Far Cry and Bioshock), which are rightly heralded as amazing games, Half-Life makes your jaw drop at how amazing of an experience it is to fight throuth the crumbling Black Mesa facility battling humans and headcrabs alike. This game really makes you realize how much Jason Brody, Booker Dewitt, and every other major  fps protagonist since owe the man with the crowbar, Gordon Freeman. If you are a sane human being who can play a video game, there is no excuse for you to not play Half-Life. None!
Игра-шедевр!
penis

If you're thinking of getting this game (I mean, the "Source" version specifically, not Half-Life in general) then don't.  Check out the excellent "Black Mesa" mod where a group of extremely motivated and talented modders recreated Half-Life 1 from the ground up in the Source engine (new textures/models/maps/everything).  This game is just a straight port of HL1 to the Source engine, and...it's aight...but yeah, you want Black Mesa.
You do sciencs for a little then you stop doing science.

In a nutshell, this is Half-Life ported to the Source Engine including all the benefits the engine provides.  I chose to play through this one instead of the original because of the more advanced engine.  Gordan Freeman must fight his way out of the Black Mesa facility after a terrible experiment release creatures from another dimension into our dimension.  The Government sends troops to silent the experiment and all survivors within the facility.  It feels like a classic FPS such as 007: GoldenEye, which is good then again it is from 1999 and Valve's first game.  There isn't much reason to play this other than to learn of the history before Half-Life 2.  For 1999 standards I give it a 9/10, for its 2004 release 8/10.  Right now, a 7/10.
Clasico y de los mejores de todos los tiempos.
great game even if it is old

The Half-Life universe is epic. Its smart and flat-out INTERESTING, something you can really sink your teeth into. Seriously enthralling. Its always got you asking; "why", "how", "WTF!?!" , you never get bored advancing through events or dialogue. You spend the game fighting your way through the Black Mesa research facility discovering what happened in the catastrophic event. Taking the role of Gordon Freeman, a theoretical physicist turned legendary hero. A man who witnesses soo much shit and accomplishes every impossible task set forth, and never has a fkn word to say. Like a boss. The silent hero of silent heroes.   He really is a legend in the game world. The story is well enough to pick up the game, but the mechanics and platforming are pretty fkn awesome too. You will actually spend a good chunk of game platforming and solving small 'puzzles', so it's not just a shooter. The game is pretty outdated, and this source version doesnt do much to revive the out of date engine. However there is a mod called Black Mesa that uses the HL2 engine and is exactly the same story and levels with just updated scenery and voice acting(same script). So you dont have to play Half-Life(original) till you get into the Xen/Alien chapters(my least favorite). Play this game.
One of the best FPS I've every played.  Great Atmosphere, balanced weapons, challenging but not un-fair obstacles, everything that a good game should be.

Half-Life, es uno de esos juegos tan aclamados por la crítica, que no te puedes morir sin haberlo jugado.

Decidí darle una oportunidad todo y que los gráficos me echaban muy atrás, pero sería muy triste no probar un juego por sus gráficos, ya que lo que importa es que nos divierta y nos entretenga.

Tras jugar unas horas me he dado cuenta, que todo y ser un FPS de hace más de 10 años, tiene una historia muy complicada y llena de interrogantes como las historias de los juegos de hoy en dia. 

El juego tiene sus momentos '' disfrutables '' (Como cuando escapas del laboratorio y llegas a Xen) y otros que son un maldito '' somnífero '' (véase el capítulo de los raíles y todos los siguientes hasta llegar a Xen, ya que te pasas la mayor parte del tiempo matando ''soldaditos''). 

Todo y tener esos altibajos, el haber sobrevivido todo lo que te ha atacado y las armas, hacen el juego un poco más agradable, cuando se hace muuuy aburrido.

No será perfecto, pero así comenzó esta serie

'' Sabia decisión Freeman, nos veremos más adelante... ''

An epic shooter reworked, if you've never played it... YOU NEED IT!!! If you have played the original, you still need this!

EDIT: Now you should probably just buy Black Mesa!
MEGA AWESOME GAME. it have a great story and really good gamepaly though its a old game

Very immersive game. All sequences and character interactions happen in game and in real time. Creepy atmosphere and enemies. There are no major gaps in between areas, everything is sequential so you feel as if you're actually exploring throughout the entire game. Wide variety of weapons, alien weapons are inventive and unique. Puzzles are clever but platforming is clumsy. Long campaign for an fps. There's very little to the story, but the events that do occur are dramatic and keep you interested. Exploration is rewarded with secret areas that provide you with health, armor and ammo. Really solid old school fps and the start of a historic franchise. Deffiently worth it if youre looking for a unique fps. 8.0/10
See: Half-Life

This game is almost exactly the same as the original Half-Life, the only difference is that it runs on a different engine (some levels are slightly different).

The original Half-Life is a much better choice to buy, because it has a wide choice of mods to play once you have completed the main game. I don't believe I have ever found any mods for this game.

Only buy this game if you want the same game as the original, but on a different engine.

A better choice is to buy the Source mod, Black mesa. Black mesa is basically a remake of Half-Life, it is basically what the modders believed Half-Life Source should have been.

For a review on the actual game, please see my Half-Life review.
If you haven't already played this...I don't know what you are doing.

tl;dr: Play for the bugs.  Buy the 1998 original for that *real* Half-Life experience.

Hell yeah.  I first bought this game in 1998, on release, and it's still better than 90% of the stuff out there. Opposing Force and Blue Shift were both released soon afterwards - OF being the same game from a soldier's point of view, and Blue Shift being the same game from Barney the Security Guy's point of view. (Barney reappears in Half Life 2.)  Half-Life: Source is a re-do of the game using a more modern 3D engine. If you REALLY want to play HL with spectacular modern graphics, go and download Black Mesa (free).
Yes.
Resulta imperdonable para cualquiera que se precie amante de los videojuegos no haber probado LA JOYA de Valve. En este caso, un remake del juego de 1998 actualizado con el motor Source.

For the record, my review of Half Life: Source can be applied to the original version of the game, except for a few asects that I touch upon regarding its transition to the Source Engine.

By now, PC gamers everywhere have grasped full comprehension of Half Life. This monument of the videogame medium as a whole was VALVe Software's very first product; one that was by no means easy to produce, but was eternally rewarding. Half Life is still being played today and enjoyed by many people, and deservedly so. For it is one of those titles in videogame history that is recognized by many; even those who might have very little experience with the franchise or its modded stand-alone offsprings.

Half Life puts the player in the shoes and HEV mark IV Protective System of everyone's favorite mute, crowbar-wielding, monster-slaying, marine-fighting theoretical physicist Gordon Freeman. The plot takes a humble beginning, as Gordon arrives to work--late--and prepares for what seems like a regular day at the Black Mesa Research Facility in the underground desert landscape of New Mexico. Perhaps a regular day, if not for the "deviation from standard analysis procedure." The player is let loose to briefly explore parts of the facility, allowing for a brief settlement before the experiment you are taking part of goes horribly wrong and all of a sudden that elevator you rode is out of order, that corridor you walked through is now covered in blood. That security  guard you talked to is trying to revive a scientist you had just run into 5 minutes ago, and that other scientist you talked to has turned into some weird mutant that is now walking towards you, though no longer with any interests of making small talk. Everything that the player had seen and gotten used to is now part of a horrific thrill ride; one that is action packed and will only get better from there.

The game's story telling is absolutely fanstastic. It delivers a truly immersive experience by never leaving the first person perspective of the player and Dr. Freeman. It sacrifices cutscenes and cinematic mumbo-jumbo for first-hand experiences and uninterrupted gameplay. Said gameplay is very satisfying. There is a very good mix of firefights of varying intensity combined with puzzles and first person platforming. The puzzles can be a tad difficult at times, but just the right kind of difficulty to encourage perseverance and reward the player for their astuteness. Firefights are also quite fun; you start out making your way through waves of hostile inter-dimensional beings and later on fight none other than the few, the proud, the Marines, who pose quite an intimidating threat. The Marines really shine in the AI department, they're aggressive but smart enough to know when to retrieve. They have a sense of personal preservation unlike anything I have ever seen in any other videogame. They will try their hardest to kill Gordon, using any tools at their disposal, but they don't want to die, and will thus will make effective use of cover and defensive tactics. 

I would highly recommend purchasing the Source version of Half Life due to some added features such as much better particle effects, improved lighting and water effects, as well as the intergrated ragdoll physics. Those not interested in such added details could easily overlook the Source version and buy vanilla Half Life, seeing as how it is the same price on Steam as the Source version, but I would highly recommend getting this version for those who haven't experienced Half Life and are looking to get into it.

You musn't dare call yourself a fan of Half Life or VALVe if you haven't played this game. Experience the original tale of a theoretical physicist trying to escape the Black Mesa Research Facility, perfectly remastered into VALVe's state of the art Source engine. It's a game you will not regreat putting your time and money into

I finally got around to playing the original Half-Life, wanting to expand my knowledge on the universe that Valve had created.

This is possibly the worst Valve game I have yet played. It has aged poorly. I guess if I had the fortune of playing it upon release I would appreciate it more, but I just can't understand how it managed to garner so much praise back in 1998. Perhaps there were some major changes that affected gameplay when they released the Source version in 2005?

The AI is completely broken. You can edge around corners and slowly pick off immobile enemies by shooting their feet. If they can't see you their AI won't kick in. Pretty terrible mechanics. Apparently the AI was taken from Half-Life 2 when HL: Source was released. It doesn't show it.

The controls are way too twitchy. It's almost impossible to succesfully climb down a ladder without dying the first time. You often go sliding off edges as if Gordon's feet are made of ice. It was certainly a frustrating experience.

There is also absolutely no story or character development. None. You are Gordon Freeman, a scientist. You open a portal to another dimension. You close the portal. The end. Everyone you meet along the way is disposable and has no distinguishing features or names.

There is no explanation for any of what is happening, there is no lead up to Half-Life 2. The reasons for the military presence are not explained, neither is the fact that they are replaced with Combine forces in the sequel, however many years later.

The only connection between Half-Life and Half-Life 2 is Gordon Freeman and the G-Man. That's it. The only recurring enemies are the headcrabs and Vortigaunt, the latter of which are apparently on your side for some reason. Who knows how they ended up on Earth if the portal was closed.

This was an amazingly empty experience, void of any story or sense of progression. I understand that was Valve's and, especially, Gabe Newell's intentions, but it just doesn't sit right with me.

I know my opinion will go against the grain and, while I did enjoy the game overall and appreciate how it is placed within the Half-Life universe, I still can not overlook the many smaller flaws that become overbearing during gameplay. I have to wonder if these issues exist in the original Half-Life game or if they are exclusive to the Source version.
Таже старая добрая half-life, только с физикой и с кучей исправленных ошибок.
